content.detailedDescription:
We were staying in a cabin in cherryville. on thursday night we were star
gazing and watching what i think were satellites track across the eastern sky, one every ten minutes or so on basically the same path.  

about 9 pm we both noticed a pop or flash of light just above the trees about 40 feet from our location. we both saw the light and looked to the spot, about three seconds later a second flash was seen about ten feet from the first.

we discussed what we saw and after a few minuets sat back down in our chairs. at that time we saw that a large portion of the south east  sky was completely blocked out. we had just been looking at the stars there and now a dark grey mass was blocking out the stars. the edges were uneven like a cloud. the night was completely clear except for this area that went dark after we saw the flashes of light.

the obstruction never drifted away or moved at all. from time to time i checked that portion of the sky and about an hour latter the view was back to normal.
content.summary: Two flashes of low altatude light  followed by obstruction of an area of the sky.

content.detailedDescription:
Sitting in chair facing south on second floor of building.  i had been sitting quietly and looking at the trees in the area.  i looked up and saw a "misty" white orb moving very fast toward the south east.  there were very few clouds and a sunny afternoon.  i watched the orb until it vanished over the horizon.  the orb never veered off the straight course, never stopped, never changed directions.

i compared the rate of speed based upon the jets i see overhead and this orb was moving at least 3 to 4 times the speed of a high flying airplane.  

it took me a few minutes to process the sighting.  i kept it to myself and that evening told the 3 other men i live with about what i saw.  they laughed and went about their business.
content.summary: Misty white orb at high rate of speed seen traveling se - 3 to 4 times speed of airplane

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving to work and noticed this extremely bright light in the sky.  it was weird how bright it was and how it stayed in the same place no matter where i turned.  i filmed for almost 45 minutes.  during the first 44 minutes nothing happened. during the last minute i found a lot of activity.  i did not notice anything at the time because i was just holding my phone and not watching it.  i found the action at home later that night when i looked through the video closely.  at first, all i noticed was the "shooting star" type thing that happens right after i go under the bridge, but on closer examination, i noticed 2 silver objects moving from the clouds before going under the bridge. one silver objects comes out of the top cloud and makes a strange directional change and moves diagonally from right to left very quickly.  the other silver object comes up from a lower cloud and i can't really tell where it goes.
i recently heard about your website and decided to let you look at the video and let me know what you think.
content.summary: Filmed 2 silver objects- one moving downward and one moving up and then something shoots out of a cloud

content.detailedDescription:
Last night i took my camcorder out to ihop restaurant to see lights close up that have been appearing in my area every night since 1986.  when i got to ihop i started reading my ufo/alien related book.  when i went outside the first thing i saw was a 100 yard long spherical cloud 60 feet over the main street.  it was 60 feet high, and 80 yards away from me.  it was pointy on its ends, and had a definite straight groove or rim all along its side.  i immediately went in the restaurant and got my camera where i filmed 6 minutes and 7 seconds of it.  three ihop employees saw it also, as they were baffled.

as soon as i got home, minutes right after filming, i could not connect to the internet with my computer, to report the sighting.  i almost ended-up buying a new modem unnecessarily.  

i do not know what to make of that sighting.  was it just a cloud or what? in about 10 minutes it dissipated completely.  although this sighting can easily be dismissed for a cloud the sky was perfectly clear.  and i never saw a cloud at such a low altitude.

this is unusual that within the past 2 weeks i had 3 unusual experiences that i reported to mufon.  it is quite a coincidence.
content.summary: Was it just a cloud or what?

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving and my daughter was a passenger traveling north on rt18 ( new castle rd) in west middlesex. we were near the west middlesex high school . there was the homecoming game happening at the time. the football field was sort of behind the school on the right side.I just happened to be glancing up looking at the stars and noticed it.It was a glowing round ball of orange yellow pink light.It wasn't casting any light from it. it just glowed. we saw the object on the left side of the road right above t. bruce campbell construction. i thought initially it was a streetlight/spotlight. it looked just like the light on a street lamp but appeared to be too high. it didn't move. we got closer and i rolled down the window. it didn't make any noise. it seemed to be slowly moving higher and more south west. i turned left onto carbaugh st. and pulled into the parking lot of regenex/ shenango steel. it sat above this building but higher in the sky now. i thought it was moving southwest so i got back on rt 18 heading south and couldn't see it. i turned around in a parking lot headed back north and thought it was gone. it may have been too far at this point.
there were people around coming and going from the game. it is possible that someone else may have witnessed it as well. about 20 minutes before this happened there had been fireworks above the football field. it seemed too large and too bright to be a remnant of fireworks. it was a pretty good distance from the football field.
when i just got on your site i saw the ball of light from alaska that was posted. it looked exactly like that. i thought someone in my area sent a pic in of the ball of light that i witnessed.
content.summary: Hovering orange ball of light

content.detailedDescription:
Took my dog out at 10pm for a last night bathroom break, and he immediately wanted to return inside.  first spotted the multicolored flashing lights along the treetops to the east.  the object then moved in a somewhat spiratic manner heading southeast, but pausing to hover every few seconds.  witnessed this for approximately 45 minutes; my iphone5 was unable to capture any video footage worth posting.
the early morning of the following day, 9/27/14, i've counted as many as six helicopters in the air at the same time.  they're moving slowly through the air, as if searching for something on the ground.
content.summary: Multicolored pulsating lights

content.detailedDescription: I looked up at the stars and observed a faint yellow light just south of the highest point in the sky (so just below 90 degrees from the ground).  then all of a sudden the object began to move to the north.  then it stopped.  then it moved to the south, but not in a straight line.  then over a period of approximately five minutes the light moved in all different directions (sometimes n or nw or ne or s or sw or se or w or e) in no apparent pattern.  sometimes it moved in a straight line and sometimes it seemed to be swerving as it moved.  when it moved, sometimes it would move for five to seven seconds.  other times when it moved, it would only move for a second or two.  there seemed to be no pattern to this either.  in other words, of the many times it moved n sometimes it traveled for many seconds and other times when it moved north it would only do so for a second.  the light would remain stationary sometimes.  when it was stationary, it seemed to flash four white lights (two on each side - one set of lights was on the west side of the light and the other side of lights was on the east side of the light).  i have seen many objects in the sky.  my children and i like to look at the stars.  i have seen jets, proper-driven planes, helicopters, blimps, and satelites in the sky.  they usually move in a straight line.  if they turn, they do so gradually.  this light moved back and forth at what must have been a fantastic speed.  when i first saw it move i thought it was a satelite because it was at such a high elevation.  i was not under the influence of alcohol nor drugs when this occurred.  i am not mentally ill.  i am a police officer (if that matters).  i am going back outside right now to see if i can keep watching it.  if i had a video camera with me i would record it.  i have never seen anything like this in my life, and like i mentioned i have spent a lot of time (at an amateur level) looking up at the stars.  i have spent many nights camping and fishing and have spent hundreds of hours stargazing.  i don't know what this thing was.  in fact, it frightens me because i didn't think aircraft could perform in ways i just observed.  probably the most unsetteling thing was the way the light sometimes "swerved" when it moved.  it's hard to describe, but it was almost like it was shaking as it moved sometimes. but at other times it didn't appear to shake when it moved.  i didn't see it swerve nor shake when it remained stationary.
content.summary: Looked like faint yellow stationary star then moved and stopped randomly in all directions not always in straight lines back and forth side to side and stationary

content.detailedDescription: Noticed it when my wife returned home from work walked up to the front step and looked up to see it have seen it there before and i'm sure i will see it againfar as i know it is still there but i'm tired and going to bed it is five a.M
content.summary: Stationary flashing lights

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving from marquette to gladstone on us-41 and observed these lights when i reached the intersection of us-41 and us-2 in rapid river. i was slowing down to make a right turn to us-2 when i noticed a single glowing orange-red object with white-ish center moving from east to west approximately 45 degrees above the treeline. i was occupied making the turn and looked to the right, but looked up again after realizing something seemed "off" about what i saw. i looked up again and immediately got goosebumps and fear sensation through my whole body.

the object itself was 1/2" in diameter from my distance, and seemed to wobble a little as it moved west. the lights of the object itself seemed to stay fairly consistent as it moved. by this time i had pulled on to us-2, but made a quick decision to pull into the rapid river mini mart parking lot to get a better view and attempt to take a picture with my phone. i drove to the west side of the parking lot and remained inside my vehicle due to fear/apprehension. i managed to get one distant blurry picture of this single object before noticing *two more* objects of exactly the same size and light description as above moving behind it in a line from the same direction (at this point i was really scared and confused!). even though i was shaken and upset - not only because of the strange orange color but because of how low they seemed to be in relation to the treeline! - i managed to get two pictures of these images, one farther away, and one with full zoom. the second picture is not steady, hence the slight blur above the lights. the orange glow isn't hardly visible at all in the pictures and looks nothing like the lights appeared in person! it was a very distinct orange-red glow. 

i left after i took the third picture out of fear and anxiety. once i arrived home to gladstone, i observed the sky to the east periodically for approximately a half hour afterwards to see if these objects would pass over my location, but i saw nothing.
content.summary: Glowing orange circular objects with apparent white-ish light at center moving west, 45 degrees above treeline.

content.detailedDescription: This photo was taken by a friend, while on his delivery route. he wanted to take a photo of the long gravel road & the corn fields in this secluded rural area. when he noticed the objects in the sky while looking at the photo the next day, he wanted to show it to me because he knows that i have always been very interested in the ufo phenomenon, & was a member & field investigator with mufon in the past. if possible, i would be interested in hearing someone else's conclusions upon analyzing this photo.
content.summary: Unknown objects were not noticed until looking at the photo the day after it was taken.

content.detailedDescription: I sitting at the kitchen table with my husband around 10pm and glanced out the window facing east and saw a bright orange round object coming from the east. it was above the tree lines and was traveling a steady pace. i said "what is that" and ran out to the patio with my husband following right behind. it was not blinking and appeared to have red on the top. it was fairly close but we didn't hear a sound. i asked my husband if it were a plane or helicopter if we would hear it since it was close. he thought we should of heard it. i ran and got my phone and started recording it. i recorded it as it traveled west until i lost it behind some trees. it was such a bright orange and appeared to have a round shape to it. i have no idea what it was.
content.summary: Observed a bright orange object with a red top flying from the east to west

content.detailedDescription: Witnessed ufo outside my window hovering in a circular motion. it was pulsating red and blue lights. it was at a higher attitude than the airplanes and was stationed in the same area. after about 15 minutes it reached a higher altitude and went south.
content.summary: Ufo in toronto - etobicoke area

content.detailedDescription:
We were standing outside on the back patio on september 24th, 2014 when we observed a series of stationary, sequential blinking red and green lights in the north-northeasterly direction. this time coincides with the series of fireballs spotted across the united states.
this evening, september 26th, 2014, we observed a similar occurrence at roughly 290 degrees (west) of compass north. the object appeared first as a cylinder and later as a cross-like shape. it was, in cross form, slightly tilted with red and green on opposing ends with 1-4 white lights in the center. 
distance from viewing is unknown but upon second viewing it had moved nearly a foot across the sky towards the northwest, opposite of the movement of the stars. time had elapsed 25 minutes between the first and second viewing. 
this was witnessed by at least three people northeast of carrollton, carroll county, ohio, usa.
content.summary: Flashing lights in distance, alternating sequential pattern of red and green.

content.detailedDescription:
i was at work.  i stepped out of the building for a smoke.  the weather was clear (bright sunlight and only a few wispy clouds near the horizons).  i observed an aircraft very high in the sky, traveling from east to west.  the aircraft was silvery and reflective in appearance.  since the aircraft was as wide as it was long, i presumed it to be a smaller jet with straight-out wings.  it’s distance away made it hard to determine it’s exact shape.  there was no visible vapor trail.  it appeared to be traveling faster than what  i would expect from a cruising aircraft (600 mph at 35,000 feet).  while moving across the sky, the aircraft had maintained a uniform speed and trajectory.  suddenly, it made a right turn.  not a right bank.  it made a right turn.  with no observable change in speed or attitude, the aircraft changed from westbound to northbound instantaneously.  i couldn’t believe what i was seeing.  it proceeded northbound for perhaps three seconds, then made a similar right turn to the east.  it then made a similar turn to the south.  one more right turn, and it was once again headed westbound.  the trajectory was straight west, but the aircraft diminished in size rapidly, indicating to me that it was gaining altitude quickly.  it was gone from sight three seconds after it’s last right turn.  two things are for sure:   what i saw was an object.   the object i saw performed maneuvers that no known modern aircraft should be able to perform.
i feel compelled to tell someone about this event.  you should be the right people to tell…
content.summary: Viewed flying object performing impossible maneuvers

content.detailedDescription:
1. 2nd floor apartment window

2. looking at the sky, straight ahead

3. a plane

4. flying east to west, then stopped flying, twinkled like a star, looked blue only in color

5.  curious, confused emotions, get the camera and film it.

6.  i didn't loose sight of it as it was statonary, i left it to see what i could see on video.
content.summary: Suddenly apeared, flew like a plane, then stopped and looked like a blue star

content.detailedDescription: My husband and i witnessed a strange object in the sky hovering over foothill ranch and mission viejo. we saw this from foothill ranch park. i went back several times and it changed direction in where it was hovering, i do suspect it is still in this area.
content.summary: Stange ufo with flashing reed, white and blue lights hovering over foothillranch and mission viejo

content.detailedDescription: Clear blue sky, 4:40pm, 2 ufos hovering up, down and sudden direction changes... then flew from east to west (as far as i could see both ways in 5 seconds...) at least 5000ft or more from ground...
content.summary: Clear blue sky, 4:40pm, 2 ufos hovering up, down and sudden direction changes... then flew from east to west (as far as i could see both ways in 5 seconds...) at least 5000ft or more from ground...

content.detailedDescription: I was talking with my neighbor & happened to look straight up through the hole in the trees at what i originally thought was a star. it glowed bright like one, but then i realized it was still to early for any stars to be out yet. the sun was still rather high above the mountains. i kept my eye on it as i sent my daughter in to grab my phone to film it. it then changed into just a grayish/white ball in the sky. then it changed to two balls in the sky then three. finally it just disappeared. all this was about 15 mins total. i was unable to get anything on my phone. my daughter says she saw it. she called it an orb.
content.summary: I looked straight up thru trees and saw what i thought was a star, except it was too early for any stars to be out yet. it stayed in that spot, but quite glowing & was just a ball in the sky, it then changed to two balls, then three then faded away

content.detailedDescription:
At 20:23 hours local time (est), i was sitting on my back deck and looking in the direction of a radio tower approximately one mile to the east. mostly clear skies and no noticeable wind. a spherical object appeared on the right (south) side of the radio tower, between the first and second lights (going from top down. the object appeared to be farther to the east from me than the radio tower. it was moderately bright, but not painful to look at, and was a whitish-orange-copper in color. it hovered for several seconds, then appeared to move forward (west) towards my location. i say that because its location in relation to the radio tower seemed to change, and the object began to appear larger.

it then made several abrupt changes in direction and elevation, moving up, down, forward and back, but remained within my field of view, my view being framed by trees and corn in the field between my house and the radio tower. i reached into my pocket for my mobile phone, but discovered that the battery was dead. i cannot say absolutely for certain, but i believe my phone to have had at least half-charge immediately before the object appeared. i know the time the incident began, because i looked at my phone as i sat down on the deck and it said "20:23" and the object appeared only a few seconds later.

the object paused on the left (north) side of the tower and seemed to grow white and brighter in color. it also seemed to pulse. i was unable to see any details under the light (no doors, windows, etc.). dogs around the neighborhood had started to bark loudly, and my own dog was trying to tug me towards the door, wanting to get back inside the house. this is very unusual behavior for her. 

at this time, there was a faint hum audible, like being close to a power substation. suddenly, the sphere disappeared and just outside where it had been, six smaller spheres with the same whitish-orange-copper coloring appeared. these appeared to be pulsing rapidly, the quality of the humming sound changed to a slightly higher pitch. at this point, my heart condition began to act up, and i developed a headache. the six smaller spheres remained visible only a few more seconds, then simply disappeared from my view. they did not drift away, move away, fall or rise; they were just there one second and gone the next. 

i went back inside my house; the time was 20:31. my heart returned to normal rhythm without any intervention or action, although the headache remained for approximately two hours. neighborhood dogs continued to bark for perhaps 5 to 10 minutes.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Spherical object with multiple direction and elevation changes observed

content.detailedDescription: We, my mother, stepbrother, daughter (just a few months old) & i were at the drive in movie theater in yuma, arizona. the movie had been playing for about an hour and it was boring me. i kept looking around because of boredom. yuma, having an airport we all were acquainted with air planes. because of this i simply assumed the dim lit lights were that of the windows of a passenger airplane. at this point i couldn't see its shape, just the lights. after about 20 to 30 minutes of glancing at what i assumed were window lights, i realized this "plane" was not moving nor was it making any sound and realized it was not a plane. i stood up in the bed of the truck and told those with me to look. i began pointing at it because they couldn't see it. its windows were too dim. when i began pointing and loudly saying "look! look! it's there" it began moving toward us. it was a very dark object, but the closer it moved the better i could see its shape. it looked as if it had a wide, huge bell on top of it. when i saw it almost over our truck, my mother and stepbrother still couldn't see it. a lady in a car next to use began trying to see it. it moved upward, tilted and that is when i saw the brighter lights on the bottom of this object. i was almost screaming for them to see it! at that moment it began moving, wobbling, and began going upward with its shape changing into a typical saucer shape. my stepbrother saw it at this point and said, "i see it! look!" at that time it began flopping from one side to the other several times. with each flop it got smaller like it was moving away. we were both tying to get my mother to see it, and she did at the point just before it went away. it was gone in a breath but left twinkly sparkles behind it. it looked as if it had gone through a door and closed it.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: We were watching a movie at the drive in theater when i noticed small lights beside the screen.

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i were driving south from elkins on the beverly pike, and we both noticed two bright orange lights, hanging low in the sky – too low to be normal air traffic, and too high to be anything earthbound. the light on the right was higher than the one on the left, suggested the object had just changed direction or was banking from a western direction of travel to a northern direction of travel. as we approached, we watched the lights get closer and appear level, as the object was traveling due north in the opposite direction of travel from us. we noticed a third dim white light in the front of the object, thus forming a triangle of lights with the two orange orbs to the rear/side. as we got closer i noticed the orange lights were hourglass shaped. last night was very clear, devoid of any cloud cover. this made it possible to discern the shape of the object was indeed a triangle, flat black in color, reflecting no light. this is a heavily populated area with many brightly lit businesses. the object traveled directly over a huge shopping center with walmart, and several neighborhoods. we pulled over at a ford dealership to observe, and watched as the object slowly passed by – much too slow for even a small cessna, and at a low altitude. the altitude was roughly slightly lower than that of which an airplane would be if it was about to land. i'd estimate speed at around 30-40 knots. the scale of this thing was huge! it's "wing" span i would estimate around 100 yds. i am very familiar with general aviation and military aircraft, and this was neither. i saw no discernible control surfaces, canopy, windows, or any other feature – just flat black with two orange lights and one white dim light. as the object passed by us, it disappeared as if using a cloaking device. all we could see was stars. again, this is a very heavily populated and bustling area. anyone traveling south on the beverly pike between 8:35 and 8:40 would have seen it, as it was flying parallel with the five-lane on the walmart side of the highway.
content.summary: Wife and i witnessed massive dull black triangle with three lights traveling n to s at low altitude

content.detailedDescription: A coworker and myself were on our way home from work and noticed these bright lights in the sky towards our left.Then they did a 180 degree flip and started moving sideways.  wasn't sure what they were i said we'll hurry to get on top the hill and see if we see anything. once we got on top where there are open fields on both sides there it came still on the left of us, on the drivers side. it just came up, did 180 degree flip went sideways then started raising up making an arch over my truck. when it was above us it was further away then when on either side. but when it was above us, it changed.It turned into a triangle with three glowing balls of orange light at the corners. then i seen two of what resembled transparent red exshust  on the bottom of the triangle. as it came back down towards the passanger side of my truck, my coworker and i talking about it and what it is doing. turns back into three bright orbs of light. pretty close to us then moves away ducking behind a row of trees and completely disappearing. we sat there for a while talking about what we had just witnessed. realizing that it made no noise, how it had changed. we know we witnessed something very unexplainable and how we felt that it knew we were watching it so it gave us a show. and how i fell very special to have had that experience.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Three bright orbs of light did 180 flips went forward and sideways went up over my truck when above changed into a triangle then back to three spheres on the other side then disapearing behind a row of trees.Keirstine shomo was with me.

content.detailedDescription: I was outside having a cigarette as usual, and also as usual i like to look at the sky to see where the planets and stars are at the moment. it was about 5:30 am and i was watching jupiter rise when directly under jupiter a light that started dim and became brilliantly bright and then gone. a second later the same thing a little further north. then i don't know if it was just coincidence but about 1 minute later i saw what looked like a fairly bright star track quickly across the entire sky from  north to south. i am assuming this was a satellite or something manmade but just a little brighter than normal because i usually cant see satellites from my house because of light pollution.
content.summary: Bright strobe light then another a short distance away

content.detailedDescription: We noticed these blinking lights of red, blue, green and white in the night sky for over a year now, so we bought a telescope and positioned it in our backyard on the one of the stationary blinking lights in the sky and took pictures and videos that are amazing! we shared these pictures and videos with our family and friends and posted it on my youtube account.
content.summary: Stationary flashing lights recorded with a telescope from our backyard

content.detailedDescription: We have been seeing these stationary lights in the sky for awhile they blink green red and white we have observed up to 14 in many different locations in the sky
content.summary: Multiple red white green stationary lights in sky

content.detailedDescription: I live at the top of a high rise condo building and have a perfectly clear view of the south and west horizons. at approximately 11:10pm i walked into the kitchen to get some water. as i fill the glass with water, i notice three very bright star-looking objects hovering in a triangle formation miles away in the west over mississauga. at first i thought they might be planes as there is an airport close by. however, my cousin (who i live with) and i see planes all day and night and have never noticed something this bright in the sky and hovering in the same position for approximately 5 minutes. anyway, after filling my glass with water i walked directly to the window and stared at the bright lights in a triangular pattern. these objects have still not moved at all. they were in the same position for a few minutes at this point. i banged on my cousin's door to get a second pair of eyes and asked him to confirm what i saw. we both stared at the bright triangle, which seemed to then pulsate slightly, but still these were the brightest objects in the sky that we've ever seen. also, every plane in the sky that we have ever seen at night either near porter airport or pearson airport have blinking lights, not solid and not even close to the brightness as these three star-like objects in a triangular formation. even if three planes were flying extremely close to each other coming directly at us, there is no way the lights could be that bright from that distance. as we continued to watch, the light at the bottom right of the triangle vanished. it then reappeared very bright again. eventually all three points of the triangle just vanished one by one within approximately one minute, still while remaining in the same spot.
content.summary: Bright hovering lights in a triangular formation

content.detailedDescription:
Ufo looked translucent with a bright orange glow coming from it in the center. appeared to be approx 5-10 ft across in size and was "silent" and traveling at or about 100 mph? tried to get response via laser pointer but had no response? not like the usual ones it was really close it seemed. it did appear to have what looked to be shining a "white" light thru the clouds above it? looked like it was looking for something? beam was not shining down but up?

thank you.
content.summary: Wife and i witnessed it approach from souuth east approx 1/8 mile, presented itself above us as it flew nw at approx 300-500ft?

content.detailedDescription: While sitting outside staring at the sky i noticed some stars that didn't quite look like stars, they were flashing different colored lights red, blue, white, orange, but stationary, the flashing was erratic. some of these objects were all in one area, in what looked to be almost a triangular shape with a few surrounding ones, and a couple were dispersed in other areas of the sky. some of the objects, lights, started moving, when they moved the flashing lights became intensified, they almost looked like they were swirling around, and you could almost make out what looked like a disc like shape the lights flashed in a line. they moved very fast and erratic and seemed to disappear but, it may have been cause they were so fast moving because i would notice them in a whole new area in the sky way further away, where they would stay and hover and look like flashing star like objects again. this week i have seen these star like lights, everyday, they seem star like but clearly are not, although they have never moved like they did tonight.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Multiple star like lights flashing in the sky, stationary then very fast moving with erratic lights whic made it look more disc like

content.detailedDescription:
Standing on my backyard deck at 5 am, i looked into the sky and saw a bright light that looked like an airplane, except that it was traveling much faster, like a satellite. it looked as though it were heading towards lansing capital airport, but the "plane" was too high in the sky, and traveling too quickly. also, the "plane" did not have flashing red or green lights.

then i noticed the object turned 90° very quickly, and shortly thereafter came to a complete stop, hovering in the sky. then the light descended a great distance and then continued to hover. the object then slowly panned left, and then slowly panned right, and then it ascended very quickly back to its original altitude. the object panned back-and-forth a couple more times, and then disappeared.

i happened to look away for a minute when the object disappeared, so i don't know what direction it traveled, or if it just "winked out." when the object was still in the sky, i tried videotaping what i saw, but it was too dark to record with my iphone. i used binoculars to get a closer look, but all i could see was a bright light, as though you were looking at a planet using binoculars. there may have been a sound emitted by the object, but i couldn't tell. i believe it was completely silent, or i was too far away to hear it.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Bright starlike light that quickly changed its path, hovered,  ascended, descended, all very quickly.

content.detailedDescription: I was on my patio when the object flew low and very slowly over the apartment building. there were 3 very bright lights on the underside of the vessel, in triangular format. there were no other lights, ie: green or red lights like a plane would have. the vessel made a noise that was like a dull buzz or hum, but it was fairly quiet. i ran inside and out of my front door to get another look (because it already passed over my building) but by the time i got outside, maybe within 10 seconds, the vessel had completely vanished. outside of my building, it's a very open area, so if the vessel had carried on that path, i would've unmistakably have seen it, but it just wasn't in the sky any more. i was awe struck more than anything. there was a pizza delivery man close by, but i never got a chance to speak to him to ask if he saw it.
content.summary: Triangle shaped object, low & slow flying
